docs.snippet: As early as two years ago, experts on Cuba say, Premier Fidel Castro began preparing for resumption of relations with the United States and he has not quite been able to understand why the breakthrough has not happened.
docs.lead_paragraph: As early as two years ago, experts on Cuba say, Premier Fidel Castro began preparing for resumption of relations with the United States and he has not quite been able to understand why the breakthrough has not happened.
docs.abstract: Georgie Anne Geyer article discusses resumption of relations between Cuba and US; says Castro was preparing 2 yrs ago for normalization of relations with no results; holds resumption of relations seems more apparent with Sec Kissinger's declaration that US 'is prepared to move in new direction' in relations with Cuba and Sen Edward M Kennedy's presentation of legis to Cong to remove all restrictions on trade with Cuba; holds USSR has long been pushing for renewal of Cuban relations with US; notes Cuba's econ has undergone drastic change with sugar harvest at about 6-million and econ improving considerably as result of high world price of sugar; cartoon illus of Pres Ford and Premier Castro (L)

headline.main: U.S. and Cuba Have a Lot to Talk Over

docs.snippet: The one man in South America whom drug enforcement officials say they would most like to see behind bars is Armando H. Nicolai, a 46-year-old Argentine who has been under indictment on narcotics conspiracy charges in New York since 1971.
docs.lead_paragraph: The one man in South America whom drug enforcement officials say they would most like to see behind bars is Armando H. Nicolai, a 46-year-old Argentine who has been under indictment on narcotics conspiracy charges in New York since 1971.
docs.abstract: series; notes unsuccessful efforts of Fed officials to apprehend Armando H Nicolai, Argentine citizen under indictment in NYC since '71 on narcotics conspiracy charges, and believed by many law enforcenemt officials as only Latin American capable of reorganizing so-called 'South American Connection'; notes South American Connection was comprised of major groups of Corsican traffickers, operating from Paraguay and headed by Lucien Sarti and Auguste Joseph Ricord; Nicolai's drug activities discussed; illus (L)

headline.main: Argentine Filled Key Role In Latins' Drugs Network; Argentine Played a Key Latin Drug Role
